title: Vegan Mapo Tofu (Mushroom Stock)
description: A deeply savory, spicy vegan take on classic Sichuan mapo tofu using an umami-rich mushroom stock instead of meat. Silky tofu and wood-ear mushrooms swim in a glossy, chili-bean and fermented black bean sauce brightened with sesame oil and scallions.

ingredients.notes: press 15–30 minutes and cut into 2-cm cubes
soak in warm water 20 minutes then slice

ingredients.display_name: fermented black beans (douchi), rinsed and roughly chopped

ingredients.notes: slice white and green parts separately

ingredients.display_name: mushroom stock (hot) or strong vegetable stock
cornstarch slurry (cornstarch mixed with cold water)
ingredients.notes: mix 2 tbsp cornstarch with 3 tbsp cold water
toast and grind for numbing flavor

ingredients.display_name: neutral oil for deep-frying or pan-frying tofu (optional)

ingredients.notes: approximate cooked rice; not included in cook time

steps.text: Prepare ingredients: press and cube the tofu, soak and slice dried mushrooms, mince garlic and ginger, and separate scallion whites and greens; have mushroom stock hot and cornstarch slurry mixed.
Optional—pan-fry or shallow-fry the tofu in a wide skillet with neutral oil until light golden on all sides to firm the texture, then transfer to a plate.

Heat vegetable oil in a wok or deep skillet over medium-high heat until shimmering, then add minced garlic, ginger and the white parts of the scallions and stir-fry briefly until aromatic without browning.
Add the doubanjiang and chopped fermented black beans to the aromatics and stir-fry 30–45 seconds until the oil is infused and paste becomes fragrant.
Toss in the sliced shiitake and wood-ear mushrooms and stir to coat with the spicy paste, cooking 1–2 minutes until mushrooms begin to soften.

Pour in the hot mushroom stock and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer, scraping any browned bits; add light soy sauce, dark soy sauce if using, and sugar, then simmer 3–4 minutes to concentrate flavors.
Gently slide the tofu cubes into the simmering sauce in a single layer and simmer undisturbed 3–4 minutes so tofu heats through and absorbs flavor.
Stir the cornstarch slurry to re-mix and slowly drizzle into the simmering sauce while stirring gently to thicken; continue cooking 1–2 minutes until the sauce is glossy and coats the tofu.
Turn off the heat, swirl in sesame oil, sprinkle ground sichuan pepper if using, and fold in scallion greens; taste and adjust seasoning.
Serve hot over steamed rice with a drizzle of chili oil to taste and extra scallions/scallion greens as garnish.
